name: getOneService
description:
You need to provide a Service ID ID :
- use the hardware/services service to get all available service IDs.

$ul: **costUnit**: The currency in which all energy cost values are being expressed.

**deviceSummaries**: The list of devices attached to the service.
Note: when using the Services service, this list is always empty. It is populated only when using the Service Details service.
**emittedCo2Unit**: The unit in which all CO<sub>2</sub> emission values are being expressed.
**energyConsumptionUnit**: The unit in which all energy consumption values are being expressed.

**heatingMargin**: The lowest heating margin among the heating margins of the devices attached to the service.
Note:This field will only be present if a value could be found.

**heatingMarginCoverage**: The percentage of devices attached to the service, whose heating margin could be found.
Note:This field will only be present if a value could be found.

**heatingMarginDeviceName**: The name of the device having the lowest heating margin.
Note:This field will only be present if a value could be found.

**heatingMarginDeviceUrl**: The link to the details of the device having the lowest heating margin.
Note:This field will only be present if a value could be found.
**heatingMarginUnit**: The unit in which the heating margin of the service is being expressed.
**historyParentIdKey**: The name of the key used to identify the service in the history table.
**id**: The ID of the service.
**name**: The name of the service.
**numberOfDevices**: The number of devices attached to the service.

**oneDayConfidence**: The confidence score (percentage) for the daily energy consumption, energy cost and CO2 emission values.
The lower the confidence score, the more extrapolated the values are.

**oneDayCost**: The daily cost of the energy consumed by the devices attached to the service.
Note:This field will only be present if a value could be computed.

**oneDayEmittedCo2**: The quantity of CO2 emitted by the devices attached to the service during one day.
Note:This field will only be present if a value could be computed.
**oneDayEnergyConsumption**: The quantity of energy consumed by the devices attached to the service during one day.

**oneMonthConfidence**: The confidence score (percentage) for the monthly energy consumption, energy cost and CO2 emission values.
The lower the confidence score, the more extrapolated the values are.

**oneMonthCost**: The monthly cost of the energy consumed by the devices attached to the service.
Note:This field will only be present if a value could be computed.

**oneMonthEmittedCo2**: The quantity of CO2 emitted by the devices attached to the service during one month.
Note:This field will only be present if a value could be computed.
**oneMonthEnergyConsumption**: The quantity of energy consumed by the devices attached to the service during one month.

**oneYearConfidence**: The confidence score (percentage) for the yearly energy consumption, energy cost and CO2 emission values.
The lower the confidence score, the more extrapolated the values are.

**oneYearCost**: The yearly cost of the energy consumed by the devices attached to the service.
Note:This field will only be present if a value could be computed.

**oneYearEmittedCo2**: The quantity of CO2 emitted by the devices attached to the service in one year.
Note:This field will only be present if a value could be computed.
**oneYearEnergyConsumption**: The quantity of energy consumed by the devices attached to the service during one year.
**providerId**: The ID of the server providing the service.
**totalPowerConsumption**: The total power consumption of the devices attached to the service.
**totalPowerConsumptionUnit**: The unit in which the total power consumption of the devices attached to the service is being expressed.
**updateTimestamp**: The data collection time (as an Epoch time, in seconds).
**url**: The link to the service details.
**code**: The error's business identifier.
**date**: The timestamp of the error.
**message**: The error message.
**code**: The error's business identifier.
**date**: The timestamp of the error.
**message**: The error message.
